instruction:
Mechanical Comprehension

This section of the test contains multiple-choice questions, which you must answer by using your computer mouse to select the correct response. Upon answering a question, you can go to the next question by clicking the Next button on the Menu bar.

During this section of the test, if you choose you may skip an item and then later return to that item.

When you are finished, select Submit from the Menu bar. Your Test Administrator may have set a time limit for this test section. If there is a time limit, you will be told how much time you have. If a time limit has been set for this section of the test, you will notice a countdown timer on the Header of the screen, showing the amount of time remaining to complete this section of the test.

questions.questionText: In the diagram below, a box slides down an inclined plane. Which of the following changes to the system would lead to the greatest decrease in speed?

In this example, four cannons fire identical cannon balls and loaded with the same amount of gunpowder. Assuming there is no wind resistance, based on the angle of the cannon, which will propel its cannonball the shortest distance to the right before it hits the ground.
If a ball were rolled down each of these jump ramps, which ramp would allow the ball to fly the shortest distance forward?
In the figure below, what is the maximum height that the pendulum can attain after it is released?
In the Figure, the lever has four holes that the line can hook onto to lift the weight. Which hole would you put the hook onto to cause the weight to move the shortest amount of distance upwards?
Assuming that the current is flowing, which of the following could cause the water wheel to increase its rotation speed?

options.text: Water level rises above the wheel.
The current begins to flow in the opposite direction.
The water level raises to the axle.
The water level drops below the wheel.

questions.questionText: Ball X is being launched at a wall in the direction shown in the figure. Which ball in the diagram will Ball X come into contact with first once it bounces off the wall?
Ball X is being launched at a wall in the direction shown in the figure. Which ball in the diagram will Ball X come into contact with first once it bounces off the wall?
Based upon the figure below, which of the following outcomes will occur to the platform if points A and B are pulled apart?

options.text: The platform will remain at the same level.

questions.questionText: In the figure below, what is the maximal height that the ball can attain if it is released? Assume no additional force or resistance is applied.
When does the ball have the most potential energy?

options.text: While it is sitting on top of the hill.
While rolling at the bottom of the hill.
While stopped at the bottom of the hill.

questions.questionText: In the diagram above, a box is sliding down an inclined plane. Which of the following forces slows down the box?
If Gear A were turned, which of the following would be true?

options.text: Gear A would have the same number of revolutions per minute as Gear B.
Gear B would have fewer revolutions per minute than Gear A.
Gear A would have fewer revolutions per minute than Gear B.
Gear B would have no revolutions and remain in place.

questions.questionText: If Gear B were turned which of the following outcomes would occur if each gear was attached to a separate axle?

options.text: An axle attached to the center of Gear A would turn faster than one inserted into Gear B.
Neither gear would be able to turn if an axle was attached the center of Gear A.
Neither gear would be able to turn if an axle was attached the center of Gear B.
An axle attached to the center of Gear B would turn faster than one inserted into Gear A.

questions.questionText: In the figure below, Gears 1, 2, 3, and 4 are identical. If Gear 2 is turning right, then what direction will Gear 3 turn?

options.text: Gear 3 will turn right only if Gear 1 is turning left
Gear 3 will turn left only if Gear 4 is turning right
Gear 3 will turn right only if Gear 1 is turning right
Gear 3 will turn left only if Gear 4 is turning left

questions.questionText: In the figure below, Gears 1, 2, and 3 are identical. If Gear 1 is turning right, which of the following statements regarding Gears 2 and 3 are true?

options.text: Gear 2 will turn right while Gear 3 will turn left.
Gear 2 will turn left while Gear 3 will turn right.
Both Gear 2 and 3 will turn left.
Both Gear 2 and 3 will turn right

questions.questionText: What will happen if Gear A is rotated to the right?

options.text: Gear C will rotate to the left.
Gear E will rotate to the left.
Gear F will rotate to the left.
Gear H will rotate to the left.

questions.questionText: What would happen if Gear F touched Gear I?

options.text: Gear C would turn to the left.
Gear B would turn to the right.
Gear A would not rotate in either direction.

questions.questionText: Assume Gear I is driving the other gears by turning to the left. What would happen if Gear F were removed?

options.text: Gear E will not rotate in either direction.
Gear A will turn to the right.

questions.questionText: What will happen if gear G is rotated to the right?

options.text: Gear F will turn more quickly than gear G and to the left.
Gear I will turn at the same speed to the right.
Gear A will not rotate in either direction.
Gear C will turn more quickly than gear G and to the right.

questions.questionText: What would happen if the rack were pushed to the left?

options.text: The gear in the pinion would rotate clockwise.
The gear in the pinion would rotate counterclockwise.
The pinion would be pushed off the rack.
The pinion would stop the rack from moving.

questions.questionText: The axles for Gear A and Gear B are fixed. What would happen if Rack B were moved to the left?

options.text: Rack A would move to the right.

questions.questionText: Only the axle for Gear A is fixed. If the outer ring cannot rotate, what will happen when Gear A is turned to the counterclockwise?

options.text: Gears B, C, and D will rotate counter clockwise and will orbit around Gear A clockwise.
Gears B, C, and D will rotate clockwise and will orbit around Gear A counterclockwise.
Gears B, C, and D will not be able to rotate.
Gears B, C, and D will rotate clockwise in place.

questions.questionText: Which of the following outcomes will occur if Rope A is cut at the point indicated by the arrow?

options.text: Platform A will rise up to Pulley A.

questions.questionText: Platform A can support 100 pounds, but Pulley A can only support 80 pounds. Which of the following outcomes will occur if a 70 pound weight is added to Platform A?

options.text: Platform A will remain in place.

questions.questionText: Based upon the figure below, which of the following outcome can occur?

options.text: W2 will raise if W1 is lowered.
W2 will raise if W1 is lifted.
W1 will lower if W2 is lowered.
W1 will lower if W2 is lifted.

questions.questionText: Assume Weight A is 75 pounds. Which of the following outcomes will occur if Platform A is loaded with 25 pounds?

options.text: Weight A will remain in place.
Platform A will remain in place.

questions.questionText: Pulley A can support 50 pounds and Pulley B can support 50 pounds. Which of the following outcomes will occur if Weight A is 45 pounds and Platform A is loaded with 45 pounds?

options.text: Weight A will remain in place.
Pulley B will rotate to the left.

questions.questionText: Which of the following outcomes will occur if the rope is cut at the point indicated by the arrow? Assume there is no wind resistance and Weight A is the exact same weight as Platform A.

options.text: Only Platform A will fall while Weight B remains in place.
Weight A will fall and hit the ground before Platform A.
Platform A will fall and hit the ground before Weight A.
Platform A will fall and hit the ground at the same time as Weight A.

questions.questionText: Which of the following changes would halve the force required to lift Weight A?

options.text: Place Pulley A at the same height as Pulley B and pull downwards.
The force required to lift Weight A is constant.
Remove Pulley B and pull upwards from Pulley A.
Add a pulley to the right of Pulley B at Pulley A's height and pull upwards.

questions.questionText: What is the primary advantage and the primary disadvantage of this system over simply lifting the weight?

options.text: Half the force is required to lift the weight, but twice as much rope must be pulled.
Twice the force is required to life the weight, but only half as much rope is required.
The weight can be lifted with less friction, but must be lifted more slowly.
There are no advantages or disadvantages with either system.

questions.questionText: Which of the following four fulcrum/lever combinations provides the most leverage?
Assume the weights on the beam are equal. What would happen if the fulcrum were moved to the left?

options.text: The right side of the beam would move higher.
The left side of the beam would move higher.

questions.questionText: Assume that the fulcrum is exactly halfway between the center of the 20 pound weight and the center of the beam. If both ends of the beam are being prevented from moving, what would happen if they were released?

options.text: The left side of the beam would rise higher.
The right side of the beam would rise higher.
The fulcrum would move to the left.

questions.questionText: Which of the following changes to the following fulcrum/lever combination would most effectively increase the leverage available?

options.text: Decreasing the size of the rock.
Increasing the length of the lever.
Decreasing the size of the Fulcrum.
Moving the fulcrum away from the rock.

questions.questionText: The figure on the right was constructed using the part(s) on the left. How many of the parts on the left would be required to construct the figure on the right?
The figure on the right was constructed using the part(s) on the left. How many of the parts on the left would be required to construct the figure on the right?
In this diagram each circle represents a valve with water flowing from left to right, towards the tanks. Which single valve would cut off water towards the most sections of pipe?
In this diagram each circle represents a valve with water flowing from left to right, towards the tanks. Which of the following valves must be closed to ensure that water is only sent to Tank B?
In this diagram each circle represents a valve with water flowing from left to right, towards the tanks. What valves must be closed to ensure that water is only sent to Tank A?
Which platform would remain balanced if two strings were cut? Strings are illustrated in diagram as the thin lines.
In the diagram, the platform is held up by four (4) strings. Strings are illustrated in diagram as the thin lines. Which strings do you need to cut to unlevel the platform?
In the diagram, the platform is held up by three (3) strings. Strings are illustrated in diagram as the thin lines. What is the minimum number of strings you need to cut to unlevel the platform?
Which single string can you cut to unlevel the platform? Strings are illustrated in diagram as the thin lines.

options.text: No single cut can unlevel the bar.

questions.questionText: In the figure below, the platform is held up by three (3) strings. Strings are illustrated in diagram as the thin lines. Which string is bearing the most weight?

options.text: A, B, and C are bearing equal weight.

questions.questionText: In the figure below, the platform is held up by three (3) strings. Strings are illustrated in the diagram as the thin lines. Which string is bearing the most weight?

options.text: A, B, and C are bearing equal weight.

questions.questionText: Which string is bearing the most weight? Strings are illustrated in diagram as the thin lines.
In the figure below, the platform is held up by three (3) strings. Strings are illustrated in diagram as the thin lines. Which string is bearing the most weight?

options.text: A, B, and C are bearing equal weight.

questions.questionText: In the diagram, how will the wheel react to the weights placed on it? Assume the weights are equal.

options.text: The wheel will rotate to the left.
The wheel will rotate to the right.
The wheel will remain in the same position.
The wheel will rotate right and then left.

questions.questionText: In the diagram, how will the wheel react to the weights placed on it? Assume the weights are equal.

options.text: The wheel will rotate right and then left.
The wheel will remain in the same position.
